intro: Thlaspi amani, commonly known as Amani rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves that are typically lobed or divided. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the family. Thlaspi amani is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
